text: In Greek mythology, Pontus or Pontos (, PÃ³ntos - "Sea") was one of the primordial deities, the personification of the sea. He was a son of Gaia (the Earth), by whom he is the father of Nereus and Phorcys. He was also the consort of the goddess Thalassa. Pontus has a variety of strengths including using his titan staff, which can strike lightning. Category:Greek gods and goddesses Category:Gods and goddesses of water
title: Pontus (mythology)
